unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Cereal Games
question_text: Two top cereal producers were competing with each other by putting game cards in their cereal boxes.  Toot Loops cereal claimed that $33\%$ of their boxes contained winning cards and Major Munch cereal claimed that $31\%$ of their boxes contained winning cards.  In an attempt to test this, a consumer goods company randomly purchased $60$ boxes of Toot Loops and $55$ boxes of Major Munch cereals. Find a $99\%$ confidence interval for the difference of the proportions of game cards contained in the boxes of the two kinds of cereal.
